title: Slope, Correlation When Removing Scatterplot Point: SAT vs. IQ
question_text:
A scatterplot of SAT scores versus IQ scores is shown below:

If point $(900,155)$ is removed, which of the following statements is TRUE?

choices.text: The slope of the least squares regression line decreases and the correlation decreases.
The slope of the least squares regression line decreases and the correlation increases.
The slope of the least squares regression line increases and the correlation decreases.
The slope of the least squares regression line increases and the correlation increases.
The slope of the least squares regression line increases and the correlation stays the same.

solution:

When the point $(900,155)$ is removed, the slope of the least squares regression line becomes steeper in the positive direction indicating the slope has increased.

The correlation also increases because the linear pattern has become stronger. The regression line falls on most the points and their appears to be less scatters between the points and the regression line.

Explanation of Distractors Choice 'A' is incorrect as both the slope and correlation increase. Choice 'B' is incorrect as the slope increases. Choice 'C' is incorrect as the correlation increases. Choice 'D' is incorrect as the correlation increases.
